content: three quick hats by maya davis the wool barn knits three quick hats is a great quick knit hat pattern to keep on hand for that special skein of yarn a set of mini skeins or as a speedy gift knit that can be whizzed up in a day 1 three quick hats © 2023 maya davis pattern for personal use only all rights reserved materials and information yarn approx 60 70 g in total of dk weight yarn samples are knit using the wool barn extrafine merino dk 225m / 246yds per 100g 85% extrafine superwash merino 15% nylon in following colours hat 1 driftwood 60 70 g hat 2 a driftwood 30 35 g b rose grey 30 35 g hat 3 a dusky pink b driftwood c belle epoque d rose grey e terra 12 14 g needles 3 5mm us 4 and 4mm us 6 circular needles or dpns to work in the round notions small scissors tapestry needle stitch marker gauge 24 stitches and 34 rounds = 10 x 10cm / 4 x 4 with 4mm us 6 needles in stockinette stitch knit in the round sizes adult sizes s/m l/xl s/m to fit 53-56cm / 21-22 head circumference l/xl to fit 56-60cm / 22-23 5 head circumference abbreviations co cast on k1tbl knit 1 stitch through back loop k knit k2tog knit 2 stitches together p purl bor beginning of round st s stitch es dpns double pointed needles 2 three quick hats © 2023 maya davis pattern for personal use only all rights reserved pattern notes three quick hats are classic style beanies designed with speed and simplicity in mind two adult sizes are given with options for different ribbings and colour combinations for the body follow each hat as it is written or pick and mix different ribbings and colour styles for a folded brim knit double the length of brim given in instructions these hats are quick to knit and perfect for last-minute gift knitting or make a stack and always have one on hand when you are dashing out of the door instructions hat 1 - single colour brim using 3 5mm us 4 needles cast on 108 120 sts using your preferred stretchy cast-on method join to begin working in the round taking care not to twist the sts place bor marker if needed round 1 k1tbl p1 repeat to end of round repeat round 1 until brim measures approx 4cm / 1 5 from co edge or about 14 rounds body change to 4mm us 6 needles round 1 k to end of round repeat round 1 until the hat measures approx 17cm / 6 5 from co edge or to desired length crown decreases round 1 k10 k2tog repeat to end of round round 2 k to end of round round 3 k9 k2tog repeat to end of round round 4 k to end of round round 5 k8 k2tog repeat to end of round round 6
